description:
We have noticed in our social activities, that many people do not really take care of how they treat or talk to waiters, so that is why we are doing this course, to create a better environment in restaurants and improve the relationship between client and waiter.

In this course, students will be able to know about the language used in restaurants, expressions and phrases to make accept and refuse invitations from their friends or family, and how to be polite in social events. To achieve that, we have prepared the course with different kind of resources like video lectures, worksheets, websites and tests.

Taking this course the student will be able to establish conversations in a restaurant, asking for food and others expressions that will help them in different life situations.

In every lesson they will find contents that are immerse in the Unit 4th-Tenth Grade such as:

-Language used to order food in a restaurant

-Review of expressions to make, accept and refuse invitations

-Polite expressions in a restaurant

Every section contains a quiz corresponding to every topic seen in every lecture. Quizzes are recommended take it after you are finished take the lectures, these will help you to assess and measure your learning process.

Therefore this course contains a Grammar lesson in which students will be able to know how to structure phrases about possessive adjectives and pronouns, practicing through different ways as: worksheets and external websites.

We aim not only to the language used in restaurants, but also we aim to the moral values, to treat other people as they deserve. We hope that every person that takes this course learn how to talk correctly in restaurants, and how to treat waiters properly. Opening the doors to communicate in an effective way and we hope that it will be helpful to you.
title: Tenth Grade-Unit 4: Eating Out
instructors: Andrea Torres, Marian Martinez, Isaías Parada, Jeany Argueta, Hugo Flores
